item.title: R to @jessphoenix2018: Look, the arugula had dressing so it's a salad. Also, in Australia arugula is called "rocket." I was so confused trying to figure out menus when I first moved there. Rocket certainly sounds like a sexier salad ingredient.
item.dc:creator: @jessphoenix2018
item.description: Look, the arugula had dressing so it's a salad. Also, in Australia arugula is called "rocket." I was so confused trying to figure out menus when I first moved there. Rocket certainly sounds like a sexier salad ingredient.

item.title:
Dinner when Carlos & Kaz are home:
Rainbow chard, cornbread, baked beans, mashed potatoes, veggie spicy fried chicken, mochi. üßë‚Äçüç≥
Dinner when solo after 10 hours at the barn:
Arugula in a cereal bowl, microwave mac n' cheese, pepitas, bread with nutella, Reese's Puffs. ü§™

item.title: R to @jessphoenix2018: These were some of my favorite images from those protests. There was anger and optimism. I doubt there'll be much of the latter this go around.
item.dc:creator: @jessphoenix2018
item.description: These were some of my favorite images from those protests. There was anger and optimism. I doubt there'll be much of the latter this go around.

item.title: I worked there from 2005-2007. Can't say I'm surprised, but I'm definitely sad. I photographed the big immigration protests for the State Archives back then, & I naively hoped it was a sign of good change. ((Sigh))
item.dc:creator: @jessphoenix2018
item.description:
I worked there from 2005-2007. Can't say I'm surprised, but I'm definitely sad. I photographed the big immigration protests for the State Archives back then, & I naively hoped it was a sign of good change. ((Sigh))

item.title: R to @shannonrwatts: It's a threat, not a promise.
item.dc:creator: @jessphoenix2018
item.description: It's a threat, not a promise.

item.title: Saying you're not interested in politics at this point in history is like someone watching their house go up in flames saying they're not interested in fire.
item.dc:creator: @jessphoenix2018
item.description: Saying you're not interested in politics at this point in history is like someone watching their house go up in flames saying they're not interested in fire.

item.title: RT by @jessphoenix2018: One saving grace (no pun intended) from the praying football coach case is that, since Gorsuch just lied about the set of facts, it'll be really easy to overturn* should any coach actually do what the coach did, instead of the fantasy coach Gorsuch ruled on.
item.dc:creator: @ElieNYC
item.description: One saving grace (no pun intended) from the praying football coach case is that, since Gorsuch just lied about the set of facts, it'll be really easy to overturn* should any coach actually do what the coach did, instead of the fantasy coach Gorsuch ruled on.

item.title: Roughly 2/3 of the world's entire population do not care at all about what the Bible says. It is ludicrous to force any interpretation of biblical worldview on non-believers. When someone says they don't want to follow your faith, respect them enough to stop proselytizing.
item.dc:creator: @jessphoenix2018
item.description: Roughly 2/3 of the world's entire population do not care at all about what the Bible says. It is ludicrous to force any interpretation of biblical worldview on non-believers. When someone says they don't want to follow your faith, respect them enough to stop proselytizing.

item.title: RT by @jessphoenix2018: I am the ‚Äúinnocent child‚Äù pro-lifers love to slap on posters/use to bolster arguments. My mother gave me up for adoption after being unable to access abortion. She was poor, homeless. There was no parenting help. I received a life of pain+abuse. I would‚Äôve rather been aborted.üßµ
item.dc:creator: @caslostwings

item.title: A very real consideration. People who can get pregnant are going to need to consider the what ifs if their college of choice isn't in a state with choice. https://www.politico.com/news/2022/06/24/roe-decision-colleges-pregnant-students-00042246

item.title: R to @FetsKatze: Just already losing followers en masse from this thread. My science career and my horse career are fine, but my media work may be done now.
item.dc:creator: @jessphoenix2018
item.description: Just already losing followers en masse from this thread. My science career and my horse career are fine, but my media work may be done now.

item.title: R to @highwindmk2: You're not wrong! It CAN be expensive if you want to do an international adoption, or an adoption outside of the foster system. And yes, agencies can have different criteria for adoptive parents but they're pretty up front so you can avoid ones that wouldn't work for you.
item.dc:creator: @jessphoenix2018
item.description: You're not wrong! It CAN be expensive if you want to do an international adoption, or an adoption outside of the foster system. And yes, agencies can have different criteria for adoptive parents but they're pretty up front so you can avoid ones that wouldn't work for you.

item.title: R to @motherofgators: If you want to DM questions as you go, just pop into my comments and say you have questions for me about this. I will always make time to help!
item.dc:creator: @jessphoenix2018
item.description: If you want to DM questions as you go, just pop into my comments and say you have questions for me about this. I will always make time to help!

item.title: R to @cwmagee: Oh yes, religious folks can and often do make excellent parents. I just have serious doubts about this couple's intentions... performative is indeed the correct word.
item.dc:creator: @jessphoenix2018
item.description: Oh yes, religious folks can and often do make excellent parents. I just have serious doubts about this couple's intentions... performative is indeed the correct word.

item.title: R to @highwindmk2: It's actually not expensive if you go through the foster system. That said, it's hard and painful and oftentimes prohibitive, but families receive a stipend. Yes, the government wants these kids housed so badly they actually send tax-free money to foster/adoptive parents.
item.dc:creator: @jessphoenix2018
item.description: It's actually not expensive if you go through the foster system. That said, it's hard and painful and oftentimes prohibitive, but families receive a stipend. Yes, the government wants these kids housed so badly they actually send tax-free money to foster/adoptive parents.

item.title: R to @cwmagee: I appreciate you saying that, but we're not great. We're so-so parents (learning as we go), but we are the ones fortunate enough to have our kid in our lives. They give us a very strong "why" every day.
item.dc:creator: @jessphoenix2018
item.description: I appreciate you saying that, but we're not great. We're so-so parents (learning as we go), but we are the ones fortunate enough to have our kid in our lives. They give us a very strong "why" every day.

item.title: R to @jessphoenix2018: Now that I've killed my own career, I've got to hope that people will glean something about the foster system from my words. We have to do better for the kids we have in the world now, & those who will be born due to lack of abortion access. All MUST be wanted somewhere. Please.
item.dc:creator: @jessphoenix2018
item.description: Now that I've killed my own career, I've got to hope that people will glean something about the foster system from my words. We have to do better for the kids we have in the world now, & those who will be born due to lack of abortion access. All MUST be wanted somewhere. Please.

item.title: R to @jessphoenix2018: Until then, get involved with foster youth. Mentor them via programs like @Kidsave_Intl or become a CASA (Court Appointed Special Advocate) for foster kids if you can't foster or adopt. Just help, because the system is already stretched too far.
item.dc:creator: @jessphoenix2018
item.description: Until then, get involved with foster youth. Mentor them via programs like @Kidsave_Intl or become a CASA (Court Appointed Special Advocate) for foster kids if you can't foster or adopt. Just help, because the system is already stretched too far.

item.title: R to @jessphoenix2018: If you are at all considering fostering or adopting an older kid, please reach out & ask questions. I am happy to answer. Kids here NOW need families. Maybe the couple that started my rant will change adopt a foster kid. If so, I will apologize & donate to the kid's college fund.
item.dc:creator: @jessphoenix2018
item.description: If you are at all considering fostering or adopting an older kid, please reach out & ask questions. I am happy to answer. Kids here NOW need families. Maybe the couple that started my rant will change adopt a foster kid. If so, I will apologize & donate to the kid's college fund.
